snippet: His fellow “Norfolk Four” defendants were pardoned in the rape and murder of a Virginia woman, but Eric C. Wilson, now free from prison, finds there is a legal impediment to clearing his name.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column on plight of Eric C Wilson, one of four sailors known as Norfolk Four convicted in 1997 rape and murder of a Virginia woman; his fellow defendants were pardoned, but conviction still stands for Wilson, though free from prison and likely innocent, which means he must register as a sex offender.
lead_paragraph: His fellow “Norfolk Four” defendants were pardoned in the rape and murder of a Virginia woman, but Eric C. Wilson, now free from prison, finds there is a legal impediment to clearing his name.

headline.print_headline: Out of Prison? For Some, That Might Mean Out of Luck
headline.seo: Eric Wilson, One of ‘Norfolk Four,’ Challenges Conviction
headline.main: Out of Prison? For Some, That Might Mean Out of Luck
